Package dataframe

Class DataFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataframe.DataFrame
  • public class DataFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    DataFrame the main object for data manipulation, most functions and all models will contructed with his object as input Its structure is a array list of column objects which themselves are generic array list representing columns in a table
    Author:
    logan.collier, Cade Reynoldson

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Changes the name of the dataframe.
        Parameters:
        name - the new name of the dataframe.

      • setNumRows

        public void setNumRows()
        Updates the number of rows in this column. Note: this does not create new rows when changing the size.

      • setColumnType

        public void setColumnType​(java.lang.String columnName,
                          char newType)
        Set column to certain type given the column's name. NOTE: DO NOT SET COLUMN TYPES WHILE INITIALIZING A DATAFRAME MANUALLY! USE SET STATISTICS!
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the column.
        newType - the new data type of the column.

      • setColumnType

        public void setColumnType​(int columnIndex,
                          char newType)
        Set a column at a specified index's data type. NOTE: DO NOT SET COLUMN TYPES WHILE INITIALIZING A DATAFRAME MANUALLY! USE SET STATISTICS!
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - the index of the column.
        newType - the new data type of the column.

      • setStatistics

        public void setStatistics()
        Initializes all of the Columns contained in the DataFrame statistics. NOTE: Can be very slow with a large dataframe!

      • setStatistics

        public void setStatistics​(int index)
        Sets the statistics of a single column at the parameterized index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the column who's statistics are to be changed.

      • updateStatistics

        public void updateStatistics()
        Updates the statistics of the entire dataframe.

        public void updateStatistics​(int index)
        Updates the statistics of a single column at the parameterized index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to update.

      • addRowFromArray

        public void addRowFromArray​(java.lang.Object[] arr)
        Adds a row to the data frame from an array. Does NOT update the statistics of the already contained columns.
        Parameters:
        arr - the new row to be added.

      • addRow

        public void addRow​(Row r)
        Adds a row to the data frame. Assumes columns for the row to initialize have already been created. Does NOT update the statistics of the columns already contained.
        Parameters:
        r - the row to be added.

      • replaceRow

        public void replaceRow​(int index,
                       Row row)
        Replaces a row in the data frame. Does NOT update the statistics of the columns already contained.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the row to be replaced
        row - the row to be added in place of the row at the passed index.

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow​(int index)
        Removes a row in the dataframe. Does NOT update the
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the row to remove.

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn​(Column c)
        Adds a column to the data frame. It's statistics will automatically be added.
        Parameters:
        c - the column to be added.

      • addColumnAtIndex

        public void addColumnAtIndex​(int index,
                             Column c)

      • addBlankColumn

        public void addBlankColumn​(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a new empty column to the data frame. Using this method will not initialize the statistics of the column, as it is empty. DataFrame.setStatistics(int index) is what you will need to use to update.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new column.

      • addBlankColumn

        public void addBlankColumn​(java.lang.String name,
                           char dataType)
        Adds a new empty column of a certain data type to the data frame. DOES NOT ADD A COLUMN TO THE STATISTICS! Use set statistics.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new column.
        dataType - the data type of the new column.

      • addBlankRow

        public void addBlankRow()
        Adds a blank row to the dataframe.

                          Column newColumn)

        Parameters:

        newColumn -

      • replaceParticle

        public void replaceParticle​(int rowIndex,
                            int columnIndex,
                            Particle p)
        Replaces a particle at a given row index (position in row) and column index (position in column).
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the position of the particle in the row being replaced.
        columnIndex - the position of the particle in the column being replaced.
        p - the new particle to be inserted.

        Removes the column at a given index from the dataframe.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the column to remove.

        Parameters:
